## Overview

Overleaf is a collaborative cloud-based LaTeX editor used for writing, editing, and publishing scientific documents. It provides real-time collaboration features and a rich text editor, making it easier to write professional academic papers, reports, and presentations.

## Key Features

- **Real-time Collaboration**: Work simultaneously with colleagues on the same document
- **Rich Text Editor**: Visual editing with LaTeX support
- **Template Library**: Access thousands of journal and conference templates
- **Version Control**: Built-in history and change tracking
- **Easy Compilation**: Automatic compilation without local LaTeX installation
- **Integration**: Connect with Mendeley, Zotero, and Git
- **Track Changes**: Review mode for manuscript revisions and peer review

## Use Cases in Research

- Writing journal manuscripts and conference papers
- Preparing grant proposals and technical reports
- Creating presentations with Beamer
- Collaborating with international research teams
- Submitting to journals with specific LaTeX templates
- Managing complex mathematical equations and scientific notation

## Getting Started

Visit [overleaf.com](https://www.overleaf.com) to create a free account and start writing with LaTeX in the cloud.
